abstract.p: This specification is defines a syntax for an XML document that contains location information about entries in a registry.

section.head: Introduction
section.p: This specification is defines a syntax for an XML document that contains location information about entries in a registry.

section.head: Background
section.p: This specification is intended to support the creation maintenance and publication of XBRL-related registries, including the XBRL function registry.

section.head: Relationship to other work
section.p: This specification does not depend on any other XBRL specification.

section.head: Language independence
section.p: The official language of XBRL International's own work products is English and the preferred spelling convention is UK English.

section.head: Terminology
section.p: This specification is consistent with the definitions of any of the terms defined in specifications that it depends on.

section.head: Document conventions (non-normative)
section.p: Documentation conventions follow those set out in the XBRL Variables Specification .

section.head: Namespaces and namespace prefixes
section.p: Namespace prefixes will be used for elements and attributes in the form ns:name where ns is the namespace prefix and name is the local name. Throughout this specification, the mappings from namespace prefixes to actual namespaces is consistent with .
The prefix column in is non normative. The namespace URI column is normative.

section.head: Syntax
section.p: This specification only provides a textual declaration of syntax constraints when those constraints are not expressed by the normative schema supplied with this specification.
Explanations of elements and attributes are only supplied when explanations are not already provided in other specifications.

Unless explicitly stated otherwise, a reference to a specific element MUST be read as a reference to that element or to any element in its
substitution group .

section.head: Attributes in the XML namespace
section.p: Any attribute in the XML namespace (http://www.w3.org/XML/1998/namespace) MAY be used on any element within a registry or within an XML resource that is referenced by a registry entry.
The xml:lang attribute MAY be used to indicate the language used to express information in the registry, as per the XML Specification .
The xml:base attribute MAY be used when resolving URIs as per the XML Base Specification .

section.head: Element: registry
section.p: The reg:registry element is the root element of a registry.

p.definition: A registry is a reg:registry element containing a list of zero or more registry entries

section.head: Element: lastUpdated
section.p: The reg:lastUpdated element contains a moment attribute whose value is the instant on which an entry in the registry was last updated.

section.head: Element: name
section.p: The reg:name element contains the name of the registry.

section.head: Element: documentation
section.p: The reg:documentation element contains either a URL that resolves to documentation of the registry or it contains XHTML markup documenting the registry.
If the documentation is provided as a URL, then the URL is specified using a reg:url element that follows the syntax rules specified in .

section.head: Element: entry
section.p: The reg:entry element is an abstract element that serves as a placeholder for concrete registry entries.

p.definition: A registry entry is an element in the substitution group for the reg:entry element that is a child of a a registry.

section.head: Element: added
section.p: The reg:added element contains a moment attribute whose value is the instant on which an entry in the registry was last updated.

section.head: Element: status
section.p: The reg:status element contains one of the following values to indicate a particular status of the entry in the registry:
When published in the public domain, a registry MUST only contain entries that have a status of PWD, CR or REC. All other entries will be removed from the registry prior to publication.

section.head: Element: url
section.p: The reg:url element contains an xlink:type attribute that equals simple and an xlink:href attribute that contains a URI that MUST resolve to the resource that identified by the registry entry.
The reg:url element MAY contain string content documenting the nature of the resource that the URL is linking to.

section.head: Element: owner
section.p: Registry entries can include a list of one or more owners.
The reg:owner element contains information about an owner of a resource that can have registry entry.
The mandatory id attribute on a reg:owner element is used to reference the owner from the revision history for a resource that is referenced by a registry entry.

section.head: Element: name
section.p: The reg:name element contains the name of the owner.

section.head: Element: affiliation
section.p: The reg:affiliation element contains the affiliation of the owner.

section.head: Element: email
section.p: The reg:email element contains the email address of the owner.

section.head: Element: assumedOwnership
section.p: The reg:assumedOwnership element contains a moment attribute that is the instant that the owner assumed ownership of the resource.

section.head: Element: relinquishedOwnership
section.p: The reg:relinquishedOwnership element contains a moment attribute that is the instant that the owner relinquished ownership of the resource.

section.head: Element: revision
section.p: The reg:revision element contains information about a revision to a resource that can have registry entry.
A reg:revision element contains either a URL that resolves to documentation of the registry or it contains XHTML markup documenting the nature of the revision.
All reg:revision elements have an on attribute that records the moment at which the revision was finalised.
All reg:revision elements have a by attribute that contains an IDREF to the ID of the owner responsible for making the revision.

section.head: Element: test
section.p: The reg:test element is abstract.
All conformance suite test resources that are referenced from within the XML resources that have entries in an XBRL registry MUST be in the substitution group for the reg:test element.
